medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with a history of recurrent upper airway infections, coarse facial features with enlarged skull, hepatosplenomegaly, umbilical and inguinal hernias, and joint contractures with claw hand deformity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient is an Italian male who initially presented at age 2 years, with a diagnosis made at age 4 years after coming to medical attention. He experienced several symptoms suggestive of infusion-associated reactions following enzyme replacement therapy, which included fever, vomiting, cough, hoarse voice, and a mild facial maculopapular rash.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of recurrent upper airway infections.
